visualization_prompt: Generate an area chart showing elevation changes along a hiking trail using GPX-derived distance-elevation data points
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two-dimensional geospatial tracking data with 121 observations of distance (quantitative, ratio scale) and elevation (quantitative, interval scale). Data is derived from GPX sensor measurements with timestamped elevation recordings at geographic coordinates. The elevation values (μ=848m, σ=250m) show a descending trend from 1237m to 415m over 11.8km distance. The area chart effectively communicates terrain profile through its filled geometry, maximizing data-ink ratio by removing non-essential chart elements. Color gradient encoding follows Cairo's principles of layered information, where the semi-transparent fill helps perception of elevation magnitude while maintaining gridline visibility. Temporal spacing of data labels at key waypoints (Start, Finish) provides cognitive anchors without visual clutter.
